qas.question: What year were the New Kingdom in control?
What dynasty maked the rise of Egypt as international power?
Who were some well known Pharaohs of the New Kindom?

answers.text: Hatshepsut, Thutmose III, Akhenaten and his wife Nefertiti, Tutankhamun and Ramesses II

qas.question: Who were some of the invaders to Egypt during the New Kingdom?

context: The New Kingdom c. <a0_0>1550–1070 BC<a0_0/> began with the <a1_0>Eighteenth Dynasty<a1_0/>, marking the rise of Egypt as an international power that expanded during its greatest extension to an empire as far south as Tombos in Nubia, and included parts of the Levant in the east. This period is noted for some of the most well known Pharaohs, including <a2_0>Hatshepsut, Thutmose III, Akhenaten and his wife Nefertiti, Tutankhamun and Ramesses II<a2_0/>. The first historically attested expression of monotheism came during this period as Atenism. Frequent contacts with other nations brought new ideas to the New Kingdom. The country was later invaded and conquered by <a3_0>Libyans, Nubians and Assyrians<a3_0/>, but native Egyptians eventually drove them out and regained control of their country.
